intro: Orthosia eichleri, commonly known as the Eichler's orthosia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy surface. Orthosia eichleri is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cooler, high-altitude environments.
